page.title: 01The Crewe&Nantwich Area.
page.content: Our area consists of twelve square kilometres to the north of the historic market town of Nantwich in Cheshire and to the east of the modern railway centre of Crewe. The area was settled at the time of the first Domesday survey and three local placenames are recorded in the first Domesday book. The area,which contains the Weaver Valley,is noted for its dairy farms. There is some industry to the east in the Crewe area.Rolls Royce and BREL are both based in Crewe. The area is becoming popular with tourists. Several well known personalities have stayed in the area,including Mrs Thatcher, the pop group ABBA and John Portlock.
